item.title: They've dumped this here, they're using this spot to dump garbage. Please, I wish it wasn't like this and that they found a solution because people are living at this point dumping garbage, and it's not fair., 19th June
item.description:
The people in the surrounding area throw garbage here, and also people who don't live nearby, and every day children pass by on their way to school, and it's not nice to see this for a whole month with garbage thrown away. This neighborhood is very nice, quiet, and clean.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gibbon Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road closures, Ruskin Ave and Kelvin Road, 19th June
item.description:
Road closures, Ruskin Ave and Kelvin Road, also temp lights at these junctions with Bellegrove Road, work (according to the permit) starts at 11.30am 19/6/2025 (today). As at 16:25 today roads were closed, temp lights in place, no works had commenced and the whole area was gridlocked, buses couldn't get through, emergency services couldn't get through, no diversion signs in place, no permit number detailed at the site (which there should be), residents of Ruskin and Woodville forced into access via Deepdene road which is a mission at the best of times due to the local school. No warning that these works were even going to take place and as at 19:41 tonight, the 19th the works still HAVEN'T started! And traffic is still backed up! Works and temp lights on Rochester way are only compounding the issue!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 119, Bellegrove Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
